AFP_ENG_20070105.0485.LDC2009T13 NEWS STORY 2007-01-05
AFP 2007 news calendar
Here is a list of major events scheduled to take place throughout 2007.
-- JANUARY --
7 - ALGERIA: 50th anniversary of the battle of Algiers, key clash in Algerian war for independence from France
7 to 21 - DETROIT: International car show
7 to 11: LAS VEGAS, Nevada: Electronics show
9 - TOKYO: Japan's Defense Agency becomes Defense Ministry for first time since World War II
10 - THE HAGUE: Trial starts at war crimes tribunal of Dragomir Milosevic, former Bosnian Serb commander during the siege of Sarajevo
11 - ADDIS ABABA:Sentence expected in the trial of former dictator Mengistu Haile Mariam, found guilty of genocide
11 - GUANTANAMO BAY, Cuba: Fifth anniversary of arrival of first prisoners at US detention camp
13 to 14 - PARIS: France's ruling UMP party to appoint its contender for April presidential election
14 - UNITED STATES: 50 years since death of US actor Humphrey Bogart
15 - BEVERLY HILLS, California: Golden Globe film awards
15 to 20 - MILAN, Italy: Men's fashion shows, autumn and winter collections
20 to 25 - NAIROBI: World social forum
21 - BELGRADE: Legislative elections in Serbia
21 to 25 - CANNES, France: MIDEM world music industry fair
22 - DHAKA: Bangladesh goes to the polls in national elections
24 to 28 - DAVOS, Switzerland: World economic forum
25 - UNITED STATES: 60 years since death of mob leader Al Capone
25 to 28 - ANGOULEME, France: International comic strip fair
27 to Feb 2 - PARIS: UN experts on climate change meet
27 - OSLO: A year of festivities is launched marking the 100th anniversary of the death of Norwegian composer Edvard Grieg
31 - PARIS: 30 years since inauguration of Pompidou Centre modern arts institution
-- FEBRUARY --
1 - FRANCE: Smoking ban comes into force in public places
1 - LEBANON: Italy takes over command of UN interim peacekeeping force from France
2 - NEW YORK: Fashion week starts
2 and 3 - PARIS: International environment conference
5 and 6 - PARIS: International UNICEF conference on child soldiers
8 to 18 - BERLIN: Berlin film festival
9 to 12 - MADRID: International fashion show
11 - LOS ANGELES: Grammy music awards
17 to 25 - MILAN, Italy: Women's ready-to-wear fashion show, autumn/winter 2007-2008 collections
18 - CHINA: Chinese New Year -- start of the year of the pig
26 to Mar 5 - PARIS: Women's ready-to-wear fashion show, autumn/winter 2007-2008 collections
25 - LOS ANGELES: "Oscars" film awards
-- MARCH --
8 - WORLD: International women's day
8 to 18 - GENEVA: Motor show
15 to 21: HANOVER, Germany: World's biggest technology fair, CeBit
22 - WORLD: World water day
25 - EUROPE: 50 years since Treaty of Rome set up the European Economic Community, ancestor to the European Union
23 to 27 - PARIS: Book fair, with special focus on India
30 to Apr 2 - MONACO: Environment-friendly motor and renewable fuels fair
-- APRIL --
2 to 14 - 25th anniversary of Falkland Islands war between Britain and Argentina
22 - FRANCE: First round of presidential election
26 - SPAIN: 70th anniversary of the destruction of the Basque town of Guernica in northern Spain, by German bombers during the Spanish Civil War
-- MAY --
6 - FRANCE: Second round of presidential election
9 - EUROPE - Europe day, commemorating key early step towards creating EU
12 - HELSINKI: Eurovision song contest
16 to 27 - CANNES, France: International film festival
24 - BERLIN: G8 industrialised nations hold forum on partnership with Africa
31 to June 1 - PARIS: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development
(OECD) holds world forum
31 - WORLD: World no-smoking day
-- JUNE --
2 to 6 - CAPE TOWN: World newspapers congress
5 - TROMSOE, Norway: World environment day
6 - MIDDLE EAST: 25th anniversary of Israeli invasion of Lebanon
6 to 8 - HEILIGENDAMM, Germany: G8 summit
10 and 17 - FRANCE: Legislative elections
10 to Nov 21 - VENICE: Venice Biennale of art
17 - ASSISI, Italy: Pope Benedict XVI presides over ceremonies for 800th anniversary of conversion of Saint Francis of Assisi
-- JULY --
1 - BRUSSELS: Portugal takes over rotating EU presidency
23 to Aug 31 - SALZBURG, Austria: Music festival
25 to Aug 2 - BAYREUTH, Germany: Wagner opera festival
27 to Aug 8 - HYLANDS PARK, Britain: World scout jamboree marks 100th anniversary of founding of the scout movement
-- AUGUST --
31 - 10th anniversary of death of Britain's Princess Diana in a car crash in Paris
-- SEPTEMBER --
Pope Benedict XV to visit Czech Republic and Austria
5 - 10th anniversary of death of Mother Teresa
16 - WORLD: World ozone protection day
-- OCTOBER --
EUROPE: 10 countries that joined EU in 2004 to become part of Schengen visa-free travel zone
4 - 50th anniversary of launch of Sputnik, first artificial satellite
8 - 40th anniversary of death of revolutionary Che Guevara
8 to 12 - CANNES, France: MIPCOM, world's largest audiovisual content fair
10 to 14 - FRANKFURT: International book fair
18 to 22 - PARIS: FIAC international contemporary art fair
-- NOVEMBER --
6 - RUSSIA: 90th anniversary of Russian revolution
14 - World diabetes day
20 - World day for rights of the child
-- DECEMBER --
1 - World AIDS day
3 to 14 - BALI, Indonesia: UN ministers' climate conference
3 - 40 years since first heart transplant
10 - Human rights day
